rest.sentence: Due to its excellent charge extraction ability, fullerene derivative phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester  is widely used as electron transport materials  in invert perovskite solar cells
However, the complicated synthetic routes and low productivity of PCBM limiting its commercial application

Moreover, the insufficient defect passivation ability of PCBM is contributed to inferior device performance because it lacks hetero-atoms/groups with lone pair electrons, it is highly desirable for exploration of new fullerene-based ETM with excellent photoelectric properties

Therefore, three new fullerene malonate derivatives were synthesized by simple two-step reaction with a high yield, and then developed as electron transport materials in invert perovskite solar cells which fabricated in air condition

The constituent thiophene and pyridyl group of the fullerene-based ETM can heighten the chemical interaction between under-coordinated Pb2+ and lone pair electrons of N, S atom by electrostatic interaction

Hence, the air-processed unencapsulated device with new fullerene-based electron transport materials  malonate ) can obtain a enhanced power conversion efficiency  of 18.38%, which is significantly higher than the PCBM-based devices

Additionally, the C60-PMME-based devices exhibit significantly more outstanding long-term stability than PCBM-based devices, owing to the strong hydrophobic properties of these new fullerene-based ETM
This study shows the promising potentials of these new low-cost fullerene derivatives as ETM to replace commercially used fullerene derivatives PCBM.

Three low-cost fullerene-based electron transport materials with excellent defect passivation and carrier separation promoting ability have been firstly applied in air-processed invert perovskite solar cells, which exhibit high efficiency up to 18.38% and good device stability.

The large use of fossil fuels has brought serious energy problems and environmental problems to human society
A search for new types of renewable energy sources has become urgent
Solar power is one of the most promising alternatives to reduce human society's dependence on fossil fuels
Perovskite solar cells  have drawn much attention in the past decade due to their outstanding photoelectric properties

With the joint effort of numerous research communities, the power conversion efficiency of perovskite solar cells have surpassed that of silicon-based solar cells, and demonstrated excellent commercial application prospects

Compared with normal planar structured devices, the inverted p-i-n structured PSCs  possess versatile benefits, such as low-temperature solution processability, low hysteresis effect, and outstanding long-term stability , .
Electron transport materials play an important role in i-PSCs, which are prone to boost electron transport, passivate defect and shield the light absorption layer from water corrosion

A variety of inorganic and organic electron transport materials have been reported up to this point, but their application has been constrained by the high-temperature calcination technique of inorganic electron transport materials  ,
Owing to their ease of synthesis and modification, organic electron transport materials have been extensively investigated and utilized in inverted i-PSCs,
Among them, fullerene derivatives  have became indispensable ETM in i-PSCs due to their low-temperature solution fabrication, high electron mobility, and well-matched energy level,
However, its synthesis involves complicated multi-steps reaction with low productivity, which hindering the commercial application of PCBM
More important, the PCBM-based devices always demonstrated unsatisfied PCE values due to the inadequate defect passivation ability

Numerous research communities have afford huge effort to develop new ETL alternatives to PCBM or PCBM derivatives, but the PCEs of fullerene-free inverted i-PSCs still lag behind those of fullerene-based devices
Hence, the development of new ETMs that possess both excellent charge extraction properties and more impressive defect passivation ability than PCBM is critical for achieving high performance i-PSCs.
It has been widely reported that functionalized fullerenes with Lewis acid/alkali group can effectively improve interactions with the perovskite layers and enhance defect passivation ability,

As the results, we report the synthesis and characterization of three fullerene malonate derivatives  malonate , C60-bis malonate  and C60-bis malonate ) with different functional groups by succinct two-steps reaction with an impressive yield
Then we study the influence of interfacial interactions between these fullerene-based ETM and perovskite on the photovoltaic performance

Compared with PCBM, fullerene malonate derivatives with the pyridine and thiophene groups exhibited dramatically enhanced coordination interactions with the under-coordinated Pb atoms at the perovskite interface due to the presence of N, S atom with lone pair electrons, which is contributed to boost device efficiency
Among them, the C60-PMME-based device demonstrated a champion PCE of 18.38%, which is significantly higher than the PCBM-based devices
Moreover, the devices based on these fullerene-based ETM exhibited superior long-term stability than PCBM-based devices
This work demonstrated a concise and low-cost method to obtain novel efficient fullerene-based ETM, which demonstrated a promising potential for application in i-PSCs to replace PCBM.
The fullerene-based electron transport materials was prepared using classic Bingel reaction
The synthesis route and molecular structure of three fullerene malonate derivatives are presented in Scheme 1
The entire synthetic route only consists of two steps and afford the desired products in 65–78% yields under very mild conditions
The detailed synthetic procedures are presented in Supporting Information
Compared with the PCBM, these fullerene malonate derivatives demonstrate an absolute

In conclusion, three low-cost fullerene based electron transport materials, C60-BAME, C60-TAME, and C60-PMME were synthesized by simple two-steps reaction and successfully employed in air-processed invert perovskite solar cell
Among them, the devices based C60-PMME as ETL indicated best photovoltaic performance with a PCE of 18.38%, which significantly higher than the PCBM-based devices
Additionally, the more excellent long-term stability could be achieved by using C60-PMME as the

Water dissociation is of fundamental importance in scientific fields and has drawn considerable interest in diverse technological applications
However, the high activation barrier of breaking the OH bond within the water molecule has been identified as the bottleneck, even for the water adsorbed on the graphene oxide
Herein, using the density functional theory calculations, we demonstrate that the water molecule can be spontaneously dissociated on GO supported by the  surface of the copper substrate
This process involves a proton transferring from water to the interfacial oxygen group, and a hydroxide covalently bonding to GO
Compared to that on GO, the water dissociation barrier on Copper-GO is significantly decreased to be less than or comparable to thermal fluctuations

This is ascribed to the orbital-hybridizing interaction between copper substrate and GO, which enhances the reaction activity of interfacial oxygen groups along the basal plane of GO for water dissociation

Our work provides a novel strategy to access water dissociation via the substrate-enhanced reaction activity of interfacial oxygen groups on GO and indicates that the substrate can serve as an essential key to tuning the catalytic performance of various two-dimensional material devices.
In this work, a novel photocatalyst of ZnIn2S4/Ni2 was designed by a simple chemical precipitation method and used to enhance hydrogen evolution under visible light irradiation
Along with vigorous discharges of hydrogen bubbles, an optimal rate of 36.3 mmol/g/h was reached under UV–Vis light for hydrogen evolution, nearly 4.9 times of the one from pure ZnIn2S4
The heterojunction exhibits steady hydrogen evolution capability and owns a high apparent quantum efficiency  of 20.45% under the monochromatic light at 420 nm

By coupling ZnIn2S4 with Ni2, an extraordinary photochromic phenomenon was detected and attributed to the active Ni-S component in situ formed between the nickel and sulfur composites under light irradiation
The emerging sulfide benefits light absorption of the system and separation of photogenerated electron and hole pairs
Besides providing a promising photocatalyst for visible light hydrogen production, the present work is hoped to inspire new trends of catalytic medium designs and investigations.
